intro: Lampranthus capillaceus, commonly known as the featherleaf gloxinia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant produces vibrant, often red or orange, flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and drought tolerance make it a distinctive addition to arid landscapes.
